intro: Mesembryanthemum cultratum, commonly known as the cut-leaf ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, often hairy leaves that are adapted to store water. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, typically during the cooler months. Its leaves are often deeply lobed or cut, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
